definition: that was one thing, and this is another/times have changed
pinyin: bi3 yi1 shi2 ci3 yi1 shi2

surname Shi

this/these

surname Shi

current situation/circumstances/current trend
the river flows thirty years to the East, thirty years to the West (proverb)/change is the only constant

definition: things are very different now (idiom)/times have changed
General Lü Meng 呂蒙|吕蒙 of the southern state of Wu (idiom); model of self-improvement by diligent study (from unlettered soldier to top strategist of Wu)
as different as heaven and earth (idiom)/worlds apart
lit. sitting at ease in a fishing boat despite wind and storm (idiom); to stay calm during tense situation/a cool head in a crisis
pinyin: ren4 ping2 feng1 lang4 qi3 , wen3 zuo4 diao4 yu2 tai2
related.word: 任凭风浪起，稳坐钓鱼台

definition: clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
lit. called a king if successful, called a bandit if defeated (idiom)/fig. losers are always in the wrong
pinyin: cheng2 ze2 wei2 wang2 , bai4 ze2 wei2 kou4

definition: to foresee/to predict
things have remained the same, but people have changed
lit. chrysanthemums after the Double Ninth Festival (idiom)/fig. outdated/thing of the past/dead letter
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
He who gives no thought to far-flung problems soon finds suffering nearby (idiom, from Analects)./Smug concentration on the here and now will lead to future sorrow.
pinyin: ren2 wu2 yuan3 lu:4 , bi4 you3 jin4 you1

definition: fortunes rise and fall/times change
No flower can bloom for a hundred days./Good times do not last long. (idiom)
as they say, .../as the saying goes, ...
